verses.plain: But now thus saith the LORD that created thee, O Jacob, and he that formed thee, O Israel, Fear not: for I have redeemed thee, I have called thee by thy name; thou art mine.

tokens.t: But now thus saith the
that created thee, O Jacob, and he that formed thee, O Israel, Fear not: for I have redeemed thee, I have called
by thy name; thou
mine.

verses.plain: When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.

tokens.t: When thou passest through the waters, I
with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.

verses.plain: For I am the LORD thy God, the Holy One of Israel, thy Saviour: I gave Egypt for thy ransom, Ethiopia and Seba for thee.

tokens.t: For I
the
thy God, the Holy One of Israel, thy Saviour: I gave Egypt
thy ransom, Ethiopia and Seba for thee.

verses.plain: Since thou wast precious in my sight, thou hast been honourable, and I have loved thee: therefore will I give men for thee, and people for thy life.

tokens.t: Since thou wast precious in my sight, thou hast been honourable, and I have loved thee: therefore will I give men for thee, and people for thy life.

verses.plain: Fear not: for I am with thee: I will bring thy seed from the east, and gather thee from the west;

tokens.t: Fear not: for I
with thee: I will bring thy seed from the east, and gather thee from the west;

verses.plain: I will say to the north, Give up; and to the south, Keep not back: bring my sons from far, and my daughters from the ends of the earth;

tokens.t: I will say to the north, Give up; and to the south, Keep not back: bring my sons from far, and my daughters from the ends of the earth;

verses.plain: Even every one that is called by my name: for I have created him for my glory, I have formed him; yea, I have made him.

tokens.t: every one that is called by my name: for I have created him for my glory, I have formed him; yea, I have made him.

verses.plain: ¶ Bring forth the blind people that have eyes, and the deaf that have ears.

tokens.t: ¶ Bring forth the blind people that have eyes, and the deaf that have ears.

verses.plain: Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the people be assembled: who among them can declare this, and shew us former things? let them bring forth their witnesses, that they may be justified: or let them hear, and say, It is truth.

tokens.t: Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the people be assembled: who among them can declare this, and shew us former things? let them bring forth their witnesses, that they may be justified: or let them hear, and say,
truth.

verses.plain: Ye are my witnesses, saith the LORD, and my servant whom I have chosen: that ye may know and believe me, and understand that I am he: before me there was no God formed, neither shall there be after me.

tokens.t: Ye
my witnesses, saith the
, and my servant whom I have chosen: that ye may know and believe me, and understand that I
he: before me there was no God formed, neither shall there be after me.

verses.plain: I, even I, am the LORD; and beside me there is no saviour.

tokens.t: I,
I,
the
; and beside me
no saviour.

verses.plain: I have declared, and have saved, and I have shewed, when there was no strange god among you: therefore ye are my witnesses, saith the LORD, that I am God.

tokens.t: I have declared, and have saved, and I have shewed, when
no strange
among you: therefore ye
my witnesses, saith the
, that I
God.

verses.plain: Yea, before the day was I am he; and there is none that can deliver out of my hand: I will work, and who shall let it?

tokens.t: Yea, before the day
I
he; and
none that can deliver out of my hand: I will work, and who shall let it?

verses.plain: ¶ Thus saith the LORD, your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel; For your sake I have sent to Babylon, and have brought down all their nobles, and the Chaldeans, whose cry is in the ships.

tokens.t: ¶ Thus saith the
, your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel; For your sake I have sent to Babylon, and have brought down all their nobles, and the Chaldeans, whose cry
in the ships.

verses.plain: I am the LORD, your Holy One, the creator of Israel, your King.

tokens.t: I
the
, your Holy One, the creator of Israel, your King.

verses.plain: Thus saith the LORD, which maketh a way in the sea, and a path in the mighty waters;

tokens.t: Thus saith the
, which maketh a way in the sea, and a path in the mighty waters;

verses.plain: Which bringeth forth the chariot and horse, the army and the power; they shall lie down together, they shall not rise: they are extinct, they are quenched as tow.

tokens.t: Which bringeth forth the chariot and horse, the army and the power; they shall lie down together, they shall not rise: they are extinct, they are quenched as tow.

verses.plain: ¶ Remember ye not the former things, neither consider the things of old.

tokens.t: ¶ Remember ye not the former things, neither consider the things of old.

verses.plain: Behold, I will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall ye not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert.

tokens.t: Behold, I will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall ye not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness,
rivers in the desert.

verses.plain: The beast of the field shall honour me, the dragons and the owls: because I give waters in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert, to give drink to my people, my chosen.

tokens.t: The beast of the field shall honour me, the dragons and the owls: because I give waters in the wilderness,
rivers in the desert, to give drink to my people, my chosen.

verses.plain: This people have I formed for myself; they shall shew forth my praise.

tokens.t: This people have I formed for myself; they shall shew forth my praise.

verses.plain: ¶ But thou hast not called upon me, O Jacob; but thou hast been weary of me, O Israel.

tokens.t: ¶ But thou hast not called upon me, O Jacob; but thou hast been weary of me, O Israel.

verses.plain: Thou hast not brought me the small cattle of thy burnt offerings; neither hast thou honoured me with thy sacrifices. I have not caused thee to serve with an offering, nor wearied thee with incense.

tokens.t: Thou hast not brought me the small cattle of thy burnt offerings; neither hast thou honoured me with thy sacrifices. I have not caused thee to serve with an offering, nor wearied thee with incense.

verses.plain: Thou hast bought me no sweet cane with money, neither hast thou filled me with the fat of thy sacrifices: but thou hast made me to serve with thy sins, thou hast wearied me with thine iniquities.

tokens.t: Thou hast bought me no sweet cane with money, neither hast thou filled me with the fat of thy sacrifices: but thou hast made me to serve with thy sins, thou hast wearied me with thine iniquities.

verses.plain: I, even I, am he that blotteth out thy transgressions for mine own sake, and will not remember thy sins.

tokens.t: I,
I,
he that blotteth out thy transgressions for mine own sake, and will not remember thy sins.

verses.plain: Put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declare thou, that thou mayest be justified.

tokens.t: Put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declare thou, that thou mayest be justified.

verses.plain: Thy first father hath sinned, and thy teachers have transgressed against me.

tokens.t: Thy first father hath sinned, and thy teachers have transgressed against me.

verses.plain: Therefore I have profaned the princes of the sanctuary, and have given Jacob to the curse, and Israel to reproaches.

tokens.t: Therefore I have profaned the princes of the sanctuary, and have given Jacob to the curse, and Israel to reproaches.

footnotes.text: no…: or, nothing formed of God
let it: Heb. turn it back?
owls: or, ostriches: Heb. daughters of the owl
filled…: Heb. made me drunk, or, abundantly moistened
